transcript.speaker: Choose a format
transcript.dialogue: Regular Table Indented Condensed
WAITING

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I think you need to get your own car. I can't pick you up every single day! Maybe you could get a bike.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Just drive. Not in the mood.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: If you think I'm going to keep picking you up like this, every day, you're sorely mistaken, little mister! Moltar and I don't work fifteen minutes a week to have you treat us like your servants. So you had just better start saving up your money, Buster Brown, because this is the last week I'm putting wear and tear on this cruiser when you can't even show a little appreciation for how hard we work! In fact, you know what I think? I think that maybe you need to get out there and find yourself a part-time job. Don't you have any skills? What do you like to do?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Nothin'.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hmm. Well, what are you good at?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Eh, everything.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'll ask my friend Merle if he needs any help.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Eh, who's Merle?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You know, Merle! At the lumberyard.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I ain't workin' at no lumberyard!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, you're not gonna be a free-loader all of your life!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (growls, mutters under his breath)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What? What did you say to me?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Em, oooh, nothin'.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And would it kill you to wear some pants every once in a while?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Are we there yet?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos in to set) Greetings! I'm Space Ghost! Joining me...

transcript.speaker: Christy
transcript.dialogue: (plays drum solo)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Eh, Christy? (waits until Christy finishes) Joining me on tonight's show...

transcript.speaker: Christy
transcript.dialogue: (starts playing drums again)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Christy! (waits until Christy finishes again) Joining me on tonight's show, Fred Cracklin! (one last cymbal crash)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: No way!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oooh, yes way! Fred Cracklin! In the flesh!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (mutters under his breath)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What! What did you say?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I ain't workin' at no lumberyard!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Play me to the desk!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (starts playing Space Ghost to the desk)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos to desk, while screen lowers with "Fred") (shouting above music) Please welcome Fred Cracklin!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (waits patiently while Zorak plays for 1:50) Alrighty!

transcript.speaker: Fred Cracklin
transcript.dialogue: Okay.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: We'll be right back with Fred Cracklin.

transcript.speaker: Fred Cracklin
transcript.dialogue: Okay.
INTERRUPT FEED

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: The set appears to be rumbling. Are we under attack, Moltar?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Hmmmm... Yep, we're under attack.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, I thought so. By one of my enemies, I bet.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, I guess one of your enemies is attacking us.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, that figures. Uh, hey, Zorak, we're under attack.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Oh, don't that beat all?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar, you better let our viewers know that we're under attack.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Yeah... (throws lever, test pattern appears:)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay, we'll level with you. The Ghost Planet isn't really under attack. All that rumbling and shaking? That was made up! We're just sitting here like normal. Moltar was shaking the camera and adding a few sound effects.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, I had a sheet of tin, and, some, uh, bubble wrap I was poppin'.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Those explosions, I was playin' that right here on my keyboard (plays a chord)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And that's not really Fred Cracklin on the monitor, it's Thurston Moore from "Sonic Youth".

transcript.speaker: Thurston Moore
transcript.dialogue: Hi.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hey, Thurston, thanks for doin' the show.

transcript.speaker: Thurston Moore
transcript.dialogue: Okay, well, thank you.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: We asked Thurston to join us because tonight, we just felt like playing you the music of Sonny Sharrock and Lance Carter. And now, here's "Ghost Planet National Anthem".
